text: Pogonocherus ovatus is a species of beetle in the family Cerambycidae. It was described by Johann August Ephraim Goeze in 1777, originally under the genus Cerambyx. It has a wide distribution throughout Europe, although it has become extinct in several countries, including Luxembourg, Belgium and the Netherlands. It measures between . It contains the varietas Pogonocherus ovatus var. subovatus.BioLib.cz - Pogonocherus ovatus. Retrieved on 8 September 2014. P. ovatus feeds on Corylus avellana, Abies alba, Abies cephalonica, Ilex aquifolium, and Castanea sativa. ==References== Category:Pogonocherini Category:Taxa named by Johann August Ephraim Goeze Category:Beetles described in 1777
title: Pogonocherus ovatus
